results.title: The Happy Revolution (New Methods in Primary Eduction)
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Robert Tyrrell
results.brief_description: A new approach to British primary education which is being debated and developed. Pupils’ minds are being opened to new worlds of ideas and experience. Children are being encouraged to find out things for themselves; through observation and exchange of ideas, but literacy is still the key to everything.

results.title: The Happy prince
results.brief_description: An animated film which presents an adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s story of “The Happy Prince”. Narrated by Christopher Plummer and Glynis Johns.
results.description: An animated film which presents an adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s story of “The Happy Prince”. Narrated by Christopher Plummer and Glynis Johns.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Literature → English literature - Film and video adaptations

results.title: The Happy prince
results.brief_description:
Based on an abridged version of the well-known story of “The Happy prince” by Irish writer Oscar Wilde. It tells of the efforts of a statue, the Happy Prince, to bring relief from poverty to the people in his town with the assistance of a dedicated swallow.
This digital video was made with a class of grade 6 students in a small village school in Dromohaire, County Leitrim, Ireland in late 2003-2004, and directed and edited by Michael Buckley. Sue McCauley was creative producer.
The production combined fine art practices and theatrical improvisation with digital media. The whole work was shot in the classroom at the school with backgrounds and animation added through compositing technique to create a visual richness through multi-layering of the imagery. The vision for the project was to make a work for an audience of children, primarily by children using a theatrical, ensemble, improvisational technique. Funded by the Australian Council for the Arts.

results.title: The Happy pace of Switzerland
results.creator_credit: Swiss National Tourist Office, Condor Films and Nicolas Gessner
results.brief_description: A story without words set to Rossini’s “String Sonata in C Major” performed by the Zurich Chamber Orchestra led by Edmond de Stoutz, involves a modern day fantasy about a truck driver’s encounter with an elegant, riderless, horse drawn coach. The parallel paths of truck and coach on the opposite shores of a lovely Swiss lake merge in a climax when the driver abandons his truck and joyfully takes up the reins behind the trotting white horse.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swiss National Tourist Office, Condor Films and Nicolas Gessner

results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: The Hand of Stalin
results.creator_credit: Tom Roberts, John Walker, British Broadcasting Corporation and October Films
results.brief_description: A three part series examining the history of Stalinism in the former Soviet UnioN focusing on oral histories of people who lived through the turbulent and totalitarian Communist regime of the late 1930s. As they relive memories of collectivisation, the purges and the Gulags, the series becomes an almost unbearable testament to the brutality of power. However, by talking to peasants, intellectuals, former KGB and dissenters, the series avoids histrionics and controversy and allows the dignity of people’s voices to tell their own stories.

results.title: The Hand of death = Shaolin men
results.creator_credit: Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest and John Woo
results.brief_description: John Woo wrote and directed this action film starring Jackie Chan, Samo Hung, Dorian Tan and James Tien. Following the breakup of their group after an invasion from the rival Manchus, 8 Shaolin renegades form their own resistance group. They train under their old leader, until he deems them ready enough to challenge the Manchus and save the Chung Dynasty. Poorly dubbed into English.
